data.question: What is the melting temperature of Mn(eba)3[MnCl4]?
Which compound has the highest melting temperature among Mn(eba)3[MnCl4], Mn(eba)3[ZnCl4], and Fe(eba)3[FeCl4]?
Is the melting transition of Co(eba)3[ZnCl4] reversible?
What is the glass transition temperature of Mn(eba)3[MnCl4]?
Which compound has a higher degree of preserved hydrogen-bonding interactions in its glassy state, Mn(eba)3[MnCl4] or Mn(eba)3[ZnCl4]?
Does the crystallization rate of Mn(eba)3[MnCl4] follow Arrhenius behavior?
What is the activation energy for crystallization of Mn(eba)3[ZnCl4]?
Which compound shows a larger contrast ratio in absorption coefficient at 650 nm, 1-Mn/Co(Zn) or Fe(eba)3[FeCl4]?
Is the density of glassy Mn(eba)3[MnCl4] higher than its crystalline state?
What method was used to measure the variable-temperature viscosities of Mn(eba)3[MnCl4]?
Does the viscosity of Mn(eba)3[MnCl4] increase or decrease with temperature?
What is the Tg/Tm ratio for Mn(eba)3[MnCl4]?
Which compound has the highest glass stability, Mn(eba)3[MnCl4] or Mn(eba)3[ZnCl4]?
What is the main difference in the crystallization kinetics between Mn(eba)3[MnCl4] and Mn(eba)3[ZnCl4]?
data.answer: Mn(eba)3[ZnCl4] has a lower activation energy and faster crystallization kinetics compared to Mn(eba)3[MnCl4]

data.question: Is the optical switching in 1-Mn/Co(Zn) binary glass highly reversible?
What technique was used to study the local order in nanostructured materials like Mn(eba)3[MnCl4]?
What does the presence of a first sharp diffraction peak (FSDP) in the structure function indicate?
What is the effect of melt-quenching on the hydrogen-bonding interactions in Mn(eba)3[MnCl4]?
data.answer: Hydrogen-bonding interactions are reduced in the glassy state compared to the crystalline state

data.question: What is the contrast ratio in percent normalized reflectivity at 650 nm across a melt-quench-annealing cycle of 1-Mn/Co(Zn)?
What does the shift in the N–H stretch in the FTIR spectra of Mn(eba)3[ZnCl4] suggest about its glassy state?
data.answer: A higher degree of preserved hydrogen-bonding interactions in the glassy state
